intro: Geum kerneri, commonly known as the Japanese avens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, creating a showy display. Geum kerneri thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas.
